title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Modi links GST 2.0 to Atmanirbharata, urges boost in growth
items.summary:
- *Modi* frames *GST 2.0* as a next‑generation reform and calls all states to boost manufacturing and *self-reliance*. 
- He stresses *MSMEs*, *swadeshi*, and Made‑in‑India products as pillars, with Budget 2025‑26 boosting credit guarantees for MSMEs. 
- The reforms are expected to leave an additional ₹2.5 lakh crore in citizens' hands, fueling consumption across households and sectors.

items.title: IIT-M makes low-cost solar power tech for areas with less space
items.author: TNN
items.summary:
- IIT-M has designed a **dual-axis tilt-roll heliostat** using an *Arduino-based controller* to track the sun, enabling *low-cost solar concentration* for rooftops and other *space-constrained areas*. 
- The design relies on simple, affordable components and the **Astronomical Almanac** for sun tracking, avoiding expensive trackers and scarce metals. 
- Researchers are also exploring new uses, including converting electronic waste plastics into safe materials and boosting solar heating with oxide-coated Al-Cu nanoparticles in water, which raised temperatures by about *14–16%*.

items.title: Solar Defence to build MALE drones in Nagpur
items.summary:
- SDAL plans a unit in the Mihan SEZ near Nagpur to develop MALE UAS and a transport aircraft, aimed at global exports.
- The MADC approved 220 acres for the SDAL SEZ unit, with projected job creation and investment.
- The project signals India’s push in *defence and aerospace*, with the potential to expand the **export market** for unmanned systems.

items.title: Poland scrambles jets to secure airspace
items.summary:
- Poland and allied fighters were scrambled to defend Poland's *airspace* as Russia launched strikes near the border.
- The Polish Armed Forces reported that on-duty fighter pairs and *air defense* and radar systems were activated, then returned to normal around 7 a.m. local time.
- The US approved a roughly **$780 million** sale of Javelin missiles to Poland to bolster **NATO** defense and deter future incursions.

items.title: India producing more energy than ever before
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- India is producing record energy to push *self-reliance* in the power sector, with rapid *diversification* of supply from 27 to 40 countries. 
- The drive includes *green hydrogen*, biofuels, and other sources, aiming for **500 GW non-fossil capacity by 2030** and increasing natural gas share toward **15%** by 2030. 
- International outlook places India at about *25% of the expected rise in global energy demand* over the next two decades.

items.title: NTPC eyes overseas uranium assets for future nuclear fuel
items.summary:
- NTPC is exploring overseas uranium assets to secure fuel for its future nuclear projects, with a **board-approved draft MoU with UCIL** for joint due diligence.
- It plans to enter nuclear power through **ASHVINI** (JV with NPCIL) and has formed **NPUNL** to pursue independent projects, alongside collaborations with various nuclear technology providers.
- The government targets about **100 GW by 2047**, and NTPC is engaging with **Clean Core Thorium Energy (CCTE)** to assess **ANEEL** fuel deployment.

items.title: Indian mining industry players see opportunities in S Africa
items.summary:
- *South Africa's* mining regulations easing and privatisation create opportunities for *Indian* firms, says *Nitin Agrawal* of *Oza Holdings*. 
- Indian companies expect growth from *rail* and *port* upgrades, *local beneficiation*, and sourcing capital equipment from *India* as the sector modernizes. 
- The *India–South Africa partnership* in mining and infrastructure could be strengthened by skills transfer, local manufacturing, and addressing energy and water challenges.

items.title: Chip to ship: all must be made in India, Modi in Bhavnagar
items.author: Tushar Prabhune
items.summary:
- From **chip to ship**, Modi said everything must be made in India and stressed *atmanirbharta* as the path to self-reliance.
- He announced projects worth over ₹1 lakh crore, warning that dependence on imports weakens India’s self-respect.
- He blamed past Congress policies for weakening indigenous industries and highlighted the decline of shipbuilding.

items.title: MAN Industries bets on energy transition, global growth
items.author: Nisha Shukla, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- **MAN Industries** bags ₹1,700-cr export order, signaling a growing global footprint amid strong demand for large-diameter pipes, says MD **Nikhil Mansukhani**.
- Plans Saudi Arabia LSAW line (350k–400k t) and Jammu stainless-tubes plant, with exports >80% of the bid book.
- Aims to be among the **top three** global line-pipe players in five years, driven by energy transition, hydrogen-ready pipelines, and strategic joint ventures.

items.title: IAF to retire MiG-21 after six decades
items.summary:
- The IAF will retire the **MiG-21** on Sept 26, ending nearly six decades of service.
- It will be replaced by the **Tejas LCA** Mark 1A, the *backbone of the IAF* during its era.
- The jet saw action in the **1971 War** and the **Kargil War**, underscoring its enduring role and impact on India’s indigenous aerospace industry.

items.title: Rajnath Singh to visit Morocco, inaugurate TASL facility
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh*'s two-day visit to *Morocco* will deepen defence ties and strategic cooperation, per the official release. 
- Inauguration of *Tata Advanced Systems Maroc*'s new facility for the *Wheeled Armoured Platform (WhAP) 8x8* at Berrechid marks Africa's first Indian defence plant, under *Aatmanirbhar Bharat*. 
- An MoU on Defence Cooperation is expected to formalize exchanges, joint training, and industrial linkages to broaden bilateral engagement.

items.title: Retailers, quick-commerce stores packed with cheaper FMCG
items.author: Ratna Bhushan
items.summary:
- Retailers and brands are rolling out lower-priced FMCG stock ahead of **GST rate cuts**, pricing many items at 5% to spur early demand.
- Major players like P&G, HUL, ITC, Hindustan Unilever, Britannia have announced price cuts; quick-delivery platforms Swiggy Instamart and Amazon Now push discounts for a first-mover edge.
- Analysts say the GST shift could lift consumption and volumes, even as retailers absorb some tax differences to clear stock before the GST week.

items.title: PM Modi inaugurates Avaada solar project in Gujarat
items.summary:
- PM Modi inaugurated *Avaada Group*'s 280 MW solar project in Surendranagar, Gujarat, with a ₹1,600-crore investment. 
- The PM virtually laid the foundation for Avaada’s 100 MW Vadodara plant (350 acres, ₹400 crore) to be commissioned by Apr 2026, expected to cut ~212,806 tons CO2 and save ~40 lakh litres of water annually. 
- The power will be supplied to *GUVNL*, reinforcing clean energy transition and India's energy self-reliance.

items.title: South Indian cement makers hail GST 2.0 rollout
items.summary:
- SICMA praises the GST 2.0 rollout and the **cement GST cut from 28% to 18%**, highlighting its pivotal role in *housing* and *infrastructure*. 
- The lower cement cost is expected to ease construction costs, boost demand, investment, and promote formal sector growth under *Atmanirbhar Bharat*. 
- SICMA commits to supporting implementation and collaborating with stakeholders to spur India’s growth and development.

items.title: Rising silver prices push solar manufacturers to cut usage
items.summary:
- The rally in *silver* prices (about 46%) is pushing global solar manufacturers to cut silver use in modules, per **BNEF**.
- BNEF expects silver demand in solar modules to fall about *7%* to 194 million troy ounces (6,028 metric tons) this year.
- Firms are exploring alternatives such as **copper**, but progress is slow and the industry remains exposed to silver volatility and higher module costs.

items.title: Manufacturing as India's growth engine to $35T by 2047
items.summary:
- *Manufacturing* will be the engine of India's vision for a $35 trillion economy by 2047, supported by reforms like the **PLI scheme** and the National Manufacturing Mission.
- Recent indicators show momentum: IIP up 3.5% YoY in July and PMI near 59, with exports rising in Apr–Aug 2025, signaling growth potential.
- With global supply chains realigning, India aims to become a global *manufacturing hub* and, over time, an *innovation and leadership hub*.

items.title: 2nm chip production in India to boost national security, space exploration, defence sector
items.summary:
- India is moving from device assembly to advanced chip design, with **2nm** production marking a key step in tech self-reliance and strategic use in *national security*, space exploration, and defence.
- The government is expanding design capabilities with new facilities and the **India Semiconductor Mission**, backing large investments and a growing talent pool.
- By 2030, India aims to tap a global semiconductor market near **$1 trillion** while domestic demand could reach *$100–110 billion*, driven by startups, design tools, and R&D.

items.title: Sustainability now essential: JK Tyre MD
items.author: Nisha Shukla
items.summary:
- JK Tyre's MD calls sustainability essential, with the Chennai plant sourcing over 65% of electricity from solar/wind, biomass energy, and ISCC Plus‑certified tyres as a bold step toward *green mobility* and *innovation*. 
- The company is expanding capacity, deploying automation and AI‑driven analytics, and pursuing digital traceability to balance *sustainability* with profitability and to lead in the EV transition with smart tyres. 
- Circularity is central, as recycled polyester and scrap steel feed into a roadmap of localisation and scale‑up of sustainable inputs to strengthen resilience in a global market.

items.title: Madhya Pradesh secures record-low solar-plus-storage price
items.summary:
- Madhya Pradesh won tenders at *2.70 rupees per kWh* (about **3 U.S. cents**) for solar-plus-storage, the lowest price yet. 
- The two 220 MW units will deliver solar power during sunny hours and draw from batteries in the evenings, charged by solar energy and cheaper night-time grid electricity. 
- The state plans longer-duration storage and 24-hour renewable power at coal-competitive rates, aligning with India's goal of 500 GW non-fossil capacity by 2030.

items.title: SpaceX unveils $17B plan for satellite network
items.summary:
- **SpaceX** signs a $17B deal to acquire EchoStar airwave licenses to create a *mobile satellite network* offering seamless service in remote areas without extra hardware. 
- The plan expands **Starlink** to connect directly to mobile devices, building a *direct-to-cell constellation* that could pressure rivals like AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon. 
- **SpaceX** expects chipsets to be modified to talk to Starlink satellites and is pursuing partnerships in India with telcos and data centers.

items.title: CEA warns of banking risks from power plant closures
Meta gets into power trading as AI sends demand soaring
items.summary:
- *Meta Platforms* is seeking authorization to participate in *wholesale power trading* to manage its data-centre electricity needs via its *Atem Energy* subsidiary.
- As *AI energy demand* soars, big techs like *Meta Platforms*, Microsoft and Google face rising electricity costs and can hedge by using on-site batteries or generators to sell power back to the grid.
- *Louisiana regulators* approved *Entergy's* plan to build natural gas plants for Meta's largest data centre, while *Meta Platforms* has filed with *FERC* through *Atem Energy* to market power.

items.title: BARC's reactor for Navy's next-gen submarines
items.author: Srinivas Laxman
items.summary:
- **BARC** is developing a *200 MWe* reactor to boost endurance of India’s next-gen submarines, enabling longer submerged operations.
- The design aims to surpass the current *83 MWe* capacity on INS Arihant and INS Arighat, strengthening second-strike capability within the nuclear triad.
- This effort fits into broader plans for domestic nuclear reactors, including **SMRs** and other advanced designs.

items.title: MADC approves 220 acre for Solar Mihan project
items.summary:
- **MADC** approved 220 acres in *Mihan‑SEZ* to **Solar Defence and Aerospace Limited** (SDAL) for a mega defence and aerospace project, pegged at over ₹12,700 crore and expected to create about 6,800 jobs. 
- A separate project to manufacture transport aircraft and defence equipment is proposed, expected to add around *875* more jobs. 
- The land allotment is among the largest in **Mihan-Sez** and followed the MoU signed with the state government during the *World Economic Forum* in Davos; Solar Group also has stakes in the commercial explosives business.

items.title: Reducing imports in hydrogen production: Saraswat
items.author: Dr. V.K. Saraswat
items.summary:
- India aims to cut hydrogen import dependency under the *Hydrogen Mission*, targeting 5 mt by 2030 and expanding *green hydrogen* plants and electrolyzers.
- R&D boosts hydrogen storage, charging stations, high‑pressure cylinders, and private SMR participation; nine hydrogen centers and Tata infrastructure underway.
- *Green hydrogen* costs about $4–5/unit today; reforms to cut electrolyzer and power costs, promote **blue hydrogen**, and build domestic materials, aided by international collaborations and a **hydrogen alliance**.

items.title: Russia offers localisation of large & small NPPs in India
items.summary:
- Russia offered to localise large and small nuclear power plant projects as part of *civil nuclear energy collaboration* between Russia and India.
- Rosatom's director general Alexey Likhachov announced the offer during the IAEA General Conference in Vienna, noting progress at *Kudankulam* NPP and opportunities for serial construction of Russian-designed reactors in India.
- The move aims to leverage India's *industrial capabilities* to deepen energy ties and boost *local manufacturing* of NPPs.

items.title: Nvidia explores $500M investment in Wayve
items.summary:
- Nvidia signs a letter of intent for a potential **$500 million** investment in Wayve.
- Wayve, a London-based autonomous startup, uses *machine learning* with camera sensors instead of maps.
- Nvidia's involvement follows a broader pledge to invest in the British AI startup ecosystem.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard, Mazagon Dock eye TN shipyards
items.author: P Manoj, ETInfra
items.summary:
- *Cochin Shipyard* and *Mazagon Dock* plan MoUs to set up new shipyards in **Tamil Nadu**, with PM Modi present.
- *Cochin Shipyard* will sign with **HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering (KSOE)** for long-term cooperation.
- India aims to expand capacity under *Maritime India Vision 2030*, moving from 0.072 to 0.33 million GT by 2030 and beyond 2047.

items.title: Agentic AI reality check: Why India’s factories are betting on small models and edge AI
Vedanta declared preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
Oil India, Hindustan Copper sign MoU for exploration of critical minerals
Our efforts are focussed on reducing imports in hydrogen production: NITI Aayog member Saraswat
Explained: How hydrogen is shaping India’s rockets, transport, and clean energy push
Delhi cuts MRPs as GST on drugs and devices drops
items.summary:
- The *Delhi Drugs Control Department* directed manufacturers to revise *MRPs* in line with the new *GST* cuts, making lifesaving medicines and devices cheaper.
- The *GST Council* cut healthcare tax slabs from 12% to 5%; 33 essential lifesaving medicines are now *GST-free*, and medical devices like glucometers will be taxed at 5%.
- Revisions require a *no-objection certificate* from the state licensing authority; savings reach patients (e.g., ₹1,000 to about ₹950) with labels reflecting the revised price.

items.title: Maharashtra to lead green steel drive: CM Fadnavis
items.summary:
- *Maharashtra* will lead in steel production and play a pivotal role in India's **Green Steel Mission**, in line with PM Modi's vision.
- CM Fadnavis announced projects worth ₹80,000 crore and said *Gadchiroli* could become India’s new steel city with major investments.
- The state targets 58% of energy from renewables by 2030 and 16,000 MW of solar power for farmers by 2026, reducing subsidies and industrial tariffs.

items.title: Modi to lay foundation stone for nuclear plant in Rajasthan
items.summary:
- PM Modi will lay the foundation stone for the **Mahi-Banswara Nuclear Power Plant** in *Rajasthan* on Sept 25, also inaugurating projects worth over ₹1.21 lakh crore.
- Modi will flag off **Vande Bharat Express** routes (Bikaner-Delhi, Jodhpur-Delhi) and **Udaipur-Chandigarh Express**, boosting *clean energy* initiatives.
- The event will be livestreamed to connect district HQs and gram panchayats; the nuclear project alone is pegged at about ₹45,000 crore.

items.title: Intel–Nvidia deal a mixed blessing for Asian chipmakers
items.summary:
- **Nvidia**'s $5B stake in **Intel** and a joint plan to co-develop PC and data-center chips could help **Intel** revive its foundry ambitions.
- For **TSMC** and **Samsung**, Intel’s revival may ease US scrutiny in the near term but could heighten long‑term competition and shift chip‑making dynamics.
- Analysts say the outcome remains uncertain, with Intel’s progress potentially influencing US domestic‑production policy and **Nvidia**/AMD positioning.

items.title: Dorf Ketal in $1.6 bn talks to acquire Italy’s Italmatch from Bain Capital
items.author: Arijit Barman, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Dorf Ketal is in advanced negotiations to acquire **Italmatch Chemicals** SpA from **Bain Capital** for *$1.6 billion*, signaling a major consolidation in the specialty chemicals sector.
- The deal is in exclusivity with terms to be finalized in weeks, potentially expanding **Dorf Ketal’s global footprint** and its adjacencies in water treatment, lubricants and additives.
- Italmatch’s US presence and 20 plants worldwide would complement **Dorf Ketal’s** operations, strengthening the growth plan amid a sector upcycle.

items.title: Ukraine to expand its weapons industry to deter Russia
items.summary:
- Ukraine plans to triple its *weapons production* and cut reliance on *Western partners* amid the war with *Russia*. 
- Drones and robotics, such as FRDM's quadcopter and Gurza armored vehicles, are accelerating Ukraine's battlefield edge with *drones* and *Gurza* systems. 
- Europe and partners are funding *joint ventures* to license and manufacture arms for Kyiv to strengthen *deterrence*.

items.title: Rajasthan to set up 6,000 MW energy storage project
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- *Rajasthan* plans to develop a **6,000 MW** battery energy storage system (BESS) with **central government** support to store daytime renewable energy and supply it at night. 
- MoUs worth ₹2,00,800 crore with central undertakings aim to meet future energy needs, covering about **4,895 MW conventional** and **38,343 MW renewable** capacity. 
- Implementation milestones include **500 MW/1,000 MWh** BESS with **Viability Gap Funding (VGF)** targeting completion by December 2026, plus additional allocations and tenders in 2025 for **1,000 MW/2,000 MWh** and **2,000 MWh**.

items.title: Vedanta declared preferred bidder for manganese block in Andhra Pradesh
ISM 2.0: India's $20B chip plan
items.author: Sankara Mahadevan
items.summary:
- *ISM 2.0* expands beyond fabs to include *compound semiconductors*, packaging, and design incentives to build an ecosystem.
- It faces execution risks like policy gaps and delays, but could turn India into a global semiconductor hub with discipline and partnerships.
- The plan highlights *policy stability*, *ease of doing business*, and *talent development* as keys to success.

items.title: NRB Bearings plans learning centre for retirees
items.summary:
- **NRB Bearings** plans an advanced manufacturing centre in *Aurangabad* to train retirees and younger staff as mentors.
- The programme blends retirees with tech‑savvy youngsters, turning retirees into trainers and offering a residential sabbatical at the learning centre.
- *Harshbeena Zaveri*, MD, says AI and collaboration will boost productivity by blending technology with experience for a people‑centric growth approach.

items.title: Marvell in talks with Indian fabs for chip fabrication
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- Marvell is in NDA-protected talks with Indian fabs to outsource chip fabrication in India.
- Vice-President *Rishi Chugh* says the long-term moonshot is a fully made-in-India rack designed, assembled and built domestically.
- India must aim for the *cutting-edge* nodes and **advanced packaging** to attract top talent and ensure future-ready deployments.

items.title: India must bridge gaps in critical mineral ecosystem, says Hindalco CTO
items.summary:
- India must bridge gaps in its mineral ecosystem to achieve self-reliance in *clean energy* and manufacturing, says Hindalco CTO Vilas Tathavadkar.
- He calls for industry–academia–government collaboration to close value-chain gaps—from exploration to purification and end-use, like *semiconductor manufacturing*.
- He warns of skilled-workforce shortages, emphasizes *recycling*, and urges reforms and an export-minded, scalable policy to build the ecosystem quickly.

items.title: Hind Rectifiers acquires BeLink for €1 million
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hind Rectifiers acquired *BeLink Solutions*, a France-based company in **robotics** and **EMS**, for €1 million in cash funded by internal accruals.
- Under the deal, €2 million will be infused into the subsidiary, with Hind subscribing €1 million as *preference shares* and the remaining €1 million as *equity shares*, giving Hind ~66% and promoter 34%.
- BeLink is expected to generate €13 million in revenue in 2025, with €10 million in pending orders for 2026, helping Hind Rectifiers establish a *European manufacturing presence* in *robotics* and *EMS*.

items.title: Odisha minister admits fertiliser black marketing
items.summary:
- Odisha's Food & Supplies Minister KC Patra admitted to *black marketing* of **urea**, noting hoarding across the state.
- He claimed stock is sufficient and urged farmers not to panic, with enforcement intensified to curb the practice.
- The OPCC's **Kisan Congress** plans a Sep 23 protest (Bidhan Sabha Gherao) over fertiliser scarcity and government inefficiency.

items.title: India pushes domestic critical minerals for clean energy
items.summary:
- **India** is pushing to expand domestic critical minerals for *clean energy* and advanced manufacturing.
- The push includes policy reforms, private exploration, and the **National Critical Minerals Mission** to reduce imports.
- It aims to secure supply for *EVs*, solar, and semiconductors while ensuring environmental and community safeguards.

items.title: Panasonic is eyeing white goods PLI, all-new India plant
items.author: Shristi Achar, ETtech
items.summary:
- Panasonic is eyeing a new manufacturing unit in **India** to tap the *White Goods PLI* scheme.
- The plan aligns with shifting operations from Japan to India and growing its B2B and consumer segments, highlighted at Electronica India 2025.
- Panasonic is exploring categories under the PLI to unlock the country’s long-term market potential.

items.title: Smartphone exports jump 55% to 330M devices made in India
items.summary:
- *55% jump* in the first five months of FY 2025-26, with annual production around *330 million devices* and about *1 billion phones in use*. 
- *In Q2 2025, India overtook China to become the top smartphone exporter to the US*, aided by rapid *5G adoption* and strong demand across *mid-range and premium* segments. 
- *The electronics manufacturing sector is moving to deep component manufacturing*, with electronics production rising to *₹11.3 lakh crore* in 2024-25 and Tamil Nadu hosting *47 units* under MeitY schemes.
